Zhenyu Gan

PhD Student, Mechanical Engineering

ganzheny@umich.edu

Zhenyu is a Ph.D. candidate with a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering from the Shandong University. His interests include multibody dynamics, gait pattern analysis of bipedal and quadrupedal locomotion, and control of body-powered exoskeletons.

Publications
  • Gan, Z., Yesilevskiy, Zaytsev, P., and Remy, C.D. . "All Common bipedal gaits emerge from a single passive model". International Journal of Robotics Research. 2018.
  • Yesilevskiy, Y. Gan, Z., and Remy, C.D.. "Energy-optimal hopping in parallel and series elastic 1D monopeds". ASME J. Mechanisms Robotics. 2018.
  • Treadway, E., Gan, Z., Remy, C.D., Gillespie, R.B.. "Toward controllable hydraulic coupling of joints in a wearable robot". IEEE Transactions on Robotics. 2018.
